procedure.description: Create a step-by-step user guide for a SaaS application, considering the user's input and providing a clear, structured guide.
procedure.name: SaaS User Guide Creator
procedure.outputDescription: A structured, step-by-step user guide in text format. Each step should include a clear explanation and, if possible, reference the relevant input data (e.g., specific features, functionalities).
steps: Analyze input data to understand the specific SaaS application features and functionalities that need to be explained in the user guide.
Structure the user guide into logical sections or modules based on the application's workflow or feature categories.
For each section/module, create step-by-step instructions. Use clear and concise language, avoiding technical jargon where possible.
Include screenshots or visual aids where necessary to illustrate each step. If image data is provided as input, incorporate relevant images into the guide.
Add tips, troubleshooting advice, and FAQs to address potential user issues and enhance the guide's usefulness.
Review the completed guide for accuracy, clarity, and completeness. Ensure that all steps are easy to follow and that the guide is well-organized.
Format the user guide for easy readability, using headings, subheadings, bullet points, and numbered lists to create a visually appealing and accessible document.
Output the user guide as a single text document.

data.text:
MetricStream GRC Application User Guide

This guide provides a step-by-step overview of the MetricStream GRC application, based on the presentation by Priyabrata from MetricStream.

1. Logging In and Initial Navigation

  1. Log In: Access the MetricStream GRC application using your credentials.
  2. Role-Based Access: Note that the application uses role-based access, so the components and functionalities available will be specific to your role.
  3. Org Structure: Be aware of the multidimensional organization structure, which can increase or limit functionality.

2. Navigation Functions

  1. Top Navigation:
    • Home: Access the home page for quick access to key functions.
    • My Tasks: View your assigned tasks.
    • My Reports: Access your reports.
    • GRC Library: Take a tour of the application. The GRC Library and dashboard have submenus to help you set up and manage your Library.
    • Dashboard: Look at individual dashboards.
  2. Search: Use the search capability to find specific items or functions.
  3. Bookmarks: Bookmark frequently used items for easy access.
  4. Calendar: View your calendar for assignments and due dates.
  5. Task List: Check your task list.
  6. Briefcase: Utilize the briefcase for offline capability.
  7. User Settings: Access logging in/signing out options, set up keyboard shortcuts, and configure other settings.

3. Left-Hand Side Hierarchical Menus

Use the left-hand side menu for access to various hierarchical menus:

  • Asset Class
  • Assets
  • Controls
  • Control Objectives
  • Evidences (for uploading)
  • Financial Accounts
  • etc.

These menus are useful when executing various activities within the application.

4. Dashboard Overview

  1. Drillable Data: Everything on the dashboard is drillable.
  2. Open Issues: View the number of open issues categorized by:
    • Criticality Level (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
    • Key Risks
    • Compliance by Regulation (e.g., Reg E, Reg Z, SOX)
  3. Compliance Areas:
    • SOX, PCI, NIST SP 800 53: These areas may require attention.
    • Menu-Driven Interface: The interface is designed to be easy to use.

5. Open Issues

  1. List of Open Issues: Access a list of all open issues by criticality level.
  2. Hover Cards: Hover over an issue to see a hover card, which displays relationships between the issue and:
    • Risks
    • Open Risk Assessments
    • Dashboards
    • Reports

6. Drilling into Individual Issues

  1. Form Loading: Drilling into an issue will load the associated form.
  2. Breadcrumb Trail: Note the breadcrumb trail at the top, which shows the process stages associated with the issue (e.g., six-stage process).
  3. Process Stages: The process stages will vary based on organizational requirements (two, four, or six stages).

7. Issue Form Sections

  1. General Information: This section includes:
    • Title
    • Status
    • Classification
    • Ownership (Owner Organization and Owner)
  2. Relationships: Associate the issue with:
    • Risks
    • Areas of Compliance
    • Assets
    • Functions
    • Business Objectives
    • Organizational units

    The multi-dimensional organization structure allows you to associate library objects one-to-one, one-to-many, or many-to-many.

  3. Action Plans:
    • Creating Action Plans: Create and search for action plans associated with the issue.
    • Details: View details such as exemption type, impact (loss or gain), creation date, and creator.
  4. Resolution Summary: Enter and log the resolution summary.

8. Data Explorer

  1. Accessing Data Explorer: Use the icons to access the data in a data explorer.
  2. Mind Map Setup: The data is displayed in a mind map type of setup.
  3. Areas of Compliance: View the data by areas of compliance (e.g., Reg E, Reg D, Reg X, Reg Z, OCC, NIST).
  4. Details: Access the details associated with each area of compliance.

9. Reports

  1. Accessing Reports: Go to the Reports section to view available reports.
  2. Favorites: Set up reports as favorites for quick access.
  3. Role-Based Access: The reports you can see are based on your role-based access and the multidimensional organization structure. Data you are not permitted to see will not be visible.
  4. Report Types: Examples include BIAs by 3rd party and regulatory compliance insights.

10. Dashboards

  1. Accessing Dashboards: Navigate to the Dashboards section.
  2. Available Dashboards: You will only see dashboards that you are permitted to access (e.g., ORM overview, Compliance Audit, Connected GRC Insights).
  3. Drillable Data: Everything is drillable to view details.
  4. Risk Ratings:
    • View risk ratings for key risks.
    • Edit risk ratings (e.g., for financial risk).
    • Set the type (e.g., fraud) and area of impact (e.g., organizational behavior, people).
    • Restrict access to the owner organization, if needed.
    • Associate with individual organizations, areas of compliance, assets, etc.
  5. Approval: Send the data for approval or save it to come back to it later.

11. Hierarchical View

  1. Compliance Areas: Hierarchical view of all areas of compliance.
  2. Asset Classes: View asset classes.
  3. Assets: Look at assets individually.
  4. Business Objectives: Access business objectives.
  5. Control Objectives: Review control objectives.
  6. Controls: Access individual controls.
  7. Evidence: Review evidence.
  8. Financial Accounts: Access financial accounts.
  9. Framework References: Review framework references.

12. Returning to the Main Dashboard

  1. Clicking on the Logo: Click on the logo to return to the main dashboard.
  2. Main Dashboard Overview: View issues by rating, key risks, and compliance status.

Conclusion

The MetricStream GRC application is designed to be user-friendly with point-and-click functionality. If you have any questions or need a further demonstration, please let us know.
